articles.headline: Dreams deferred
articles.summary: An investigation into Baltimore's decaying housing revealed that a well-intentioned government effort resulted in the abandonment of neighborhoods and the accumulation of debts for low-income homeowners.

articles.headline: Experimenting with Drugs
articles.summary: An investigation into FDA drug experiments revealed that over half the human subjects were insufficiently informed about risks and benefits, raising ethical concerns.

articles.headline: Beyond the nightmares
articles.summary: A data-driven investigation into North Carolina day-cares revealed high rates of child injury and neglect due to lenient state regulations and minimal oversight.

articles.headline: Head of the Class
articles.summary: The Arkansas Democrat-Gazette used a simple statistical method to rank schools, considering factors beyond test scores to judge school quality.

articles.headline: Rigging the Results
articles.summary: An investigation into FCC auctions uncovered potential bid-rigging using signaling tactics during spectrum auctions, leading to a Justice Department inquiry.
